message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.DB, cs.LG. 

This paper is about improving entity retrieval using semantic features. The main focus is on using field-level semantic features to re-rank documents retrieved by a field-based model. This topic is closely related to information retrieval (IR) and natural language processing (NLP), which are both subfields of computer science. Therefore, cs.IR and cs.CL are the most likely sub-categories. Additionally, the paper proposes to use dense vector representations to compute semantic features, which is a common technique in machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI), making cs.AI another likely sub-category. The paper also uses the DBpedia-Entity dataset, which is a knowledge graph, and proposes a method for integrating semantic features into a field-based model, which are both related to databases (cs.DB) and machine learning (cs.LG).
